main event: A white object, resembling a star, was observed in Yuma, Arizona in February 1957 for 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed both visually and on radar.
No trail, sonic booms, or exhaust were observed.
The lights reported seemed to fade off after 15 seconds.
A long line of lights was observed, and pieces fell off as it faded out over 52 minutes.
The observer, 1/Lt Schartz, believed the object to be the star Sirius.
sighted object: White star-like object in the sky
photographs: no the report does not include photographs
